## Description {#details}

Contains the <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/avr">AVR</a> backend.

### enum  {#ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="enum llvm::AVR::Fixups ">
The set of supported fixups.

<EnumerationList title="Enumeration values">

<Link id="ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1a500fa30f51cc74e5a90492f6b302334a" />
<EnumerationListItem name="fixup_32">
A 32-bit <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/avr">AVR</a> fixup (= FirstTargetFixupKind)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1a60e6a283e3c8cbea62c15d290b3b7230" />
<EnumerationListItem name="fixup_7_pcrel">
A 7-bit PC-relative fixup for the family of conditional branches which take 7-bit targets (BRNE,BRGT,etc)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1aef7dfebd31b781d8947b5ee86ea8344b" />
<EnumerationListItem name="fixup_13_pcrel">
A 12-bit PC-relative fixup for the family of branches which take 12-bit targets (RJMP,RCALL,etc)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1a1988574074630219dd0822e790327356" />
<EnumerationListItem name="fixup_16">
A 16-bit address
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1a0a7ad8e9592283440f485e0c10e944f2" />
<EnumerationListItem name="fixup_16_pm">
A 16-bit program memory address
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1a6b7175a9e13966bf2bebe7d0f196b462" />
<EnumerationListItem name="fixup_ldi">
Replaces the 8-bit immediate with another value
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1a72001e129a73846ac51da1bc606f8c2d" />
<EnumerationListItem name="fixup_lo8_ldi">
Replaces the immediate operand of a 16-bit <code>Rd, K</code> instruction with the lower 8 bits of a 16-bit value (bits 0-7)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1a78ac987d603e1af3517bd49dacc5ee34" />
<EnumerationListItem name="fixup_hi8_ldi">
Replaces the immediate operand of a 16-bit <code>Rd, K</code> instruction with the upper 8 bits of a 16-bit value (bits 8-15)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1a382b86a3e3c868e6ddd9475944d8d1cd" />
<EnumerationListItem name="fixup_hh8_ldi">
Replaces the immediate operand of a 16-bit <code>Rd, K</code> instruction with the upper 8 bits of a 24-bit value (bits 16-23)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1a5a57de6d17ac1d7fe855d0bdf7420b7e" />
<EnumerationListItem name="fixup_ms8_ldi">
Replaces the immediate operand of a 16-bit <code>Rd, K</code> instruction with the upper 8 bits of a 32-bit value (bits 24-31)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1a58d3467e8ce0a23f1b6085534f4abf28" />
<EnumerationListItem name="fixup_lo8_ldi_neg">
Replaces the immediate operand of a 16-bit <code>Rd, K</code> instruction with the lower 8 bits of a negated 16-bit value (bits 0-7)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1aefc20853a2c98d2ef8a07255a98a6a22" />
<EnumerationListItem name="fixup_hi8_ldi_neg">
Replaces the immediate operand of a 16-bit <code>Rd, K</code> instruction with the upper 8 bits of a negated 16-bit value (bits 8-15)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1a99d632ff5fa83e7b6ad4bf40eb108cbb" />
<EnumerationListItem name="fixup_hh8_ldi_neg">
Replaces the immediate operand of a 16-bit <code>Rd, K</code> instruction with the upper 8 bits of a negated 24-bit value (bits 16-23)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1a46b76675cc30a160bdc1efdfa54c26f2" />
<EnumerationListItem name="fixup_ms8_ldi_neg">
Replaces the immediate operand of a 16-bit <code>Rd, K</code> instruction with the upper 8 bits of a negated 32-bit value (bits 24-31)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1a86089f48a39009fba6b797d64a5c3e38" />
<EnumerationListItem name="fixup_lo8_ldi_pm">
Replaces the immediate operand of a 16-bit <code>Rd, K</code> instruction with the lower 8 bits of a 16-bit program memory address value (bits 0-7)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1ab13e48e1103a86880bd207573da528e9" />
<EnumerationListItem name="fixup_hi8_ldi_pm">
Replaces the immediate operand of a 16-bit <code>Rd, K</code> instruction with the upper 8 bits of a 16-bit program memory address value (bits 8-15)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1a9ee8f8e04076fa4bb138a15c7c28691f" />
<EnumerationListItem name="fixup_hh8_ldi_pm">
Replaces the immediate operand of a 16-bit <code>Rd, K</code> instruction with the upper 8 bits of a 24-bit program memory address value (bits 16-23)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1aa45c22f2c30f421e4b2efbefde64a2b8" />
<EnumerationListItem name="fixup_lo8_ldi_pm_neg">
Replaces the immediate operand of a 16-bit <code>Rd, K</code> instruction with the lower 8 bits of a negated 16-bit program memory address value (bits 0-7)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1a766028df6cd5759254edcfea42e8296d" />
<EnumerationListItem name="fixup_hi8_ldi_pm_neg">
Replaces the immediate operand of a 16-bit <code>Rd, K</code> instruction with the upper 8 bits of a negated 16-bit program memory address value (bits 8-15)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1ac8e2243f3ba6ba72cdea9d6e5d86a504" />
<EnumerationListItem name="fixup_hh8_ldi_pm_neg">
Replaces the immediate operand of a 16-bit <code>Rd, K</code> instruction with the upper 8 bits of a negated 24-bit program memory address value (bits 16-23)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1a223843ea9d717c21dd80bf8124e9a16e" />
<EnumerationListItem name="fixup_call">
A 22-bit fixup for the target of a <code>CALL k</code> or <code>JMP k</code> instruction
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1afdbb8a9b4206897c419c5a93db879478" />
<EnumerationListItem name="fixup_6">

</EnumerationListItem>

<EnumerationListItem name="fixup_6_adiw">
A symbol+addr fixup for the &#96;LDD &lt;x&gt;+&lt;n&gt;, &lt;r&gt;&quot; family of instructions
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1aa925266a218e48fd76747c51bd83615d" />

<EnumerationListItem name="fixup_port6">
A 6-bit port address
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1aa417f149a7d5fd39ca8e72197c12b4d8" />
<EnumerationListItem name="fixup_port5">
A 5-bit port address
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1a3a1fa3eef584b35a695f93fb7e85a3a7" />
<EnumerationListItem name="LastTargetFixupKind">

</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1a6499d178b9964b2fc7b26cd8ebb82d24" />
<EnumerationListItem name="NumTargetFixupKinds">
 (= LastTargetFixupKind - FirstTargetFixupKind)
</EnumerationListItem>

</EnumerationList>

Although most of the current fixup types reflect a unique relocation one can have multiple fixup types for a given relocation and thus need to be uniquely named.


:::info
This table <em>must</em> be in the same order of <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/mcfixupkindinfo">MCFixupKindInfo</a> Infos&#91;<a href="#ae093893769f0a31accd70fbf3fd419b1a6499d178b9964b2fc7b26cd8ebb82d24">AVR::NumTargetFixupKinds</a>&#93; in <code><a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/avr/lib/target/avr/mctargetdesc/avrasmbackend-cpp">AVRAsmBackend.cpp</a></code>.
:::

</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
